decks.notes: The focus of this deck is ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful colorless spells, while disrupting opponents with control elements like board wipes and removal spells. The key strategy revolves around assembling the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, Power Plant) to generate massive amounts of mana, which allows for casting expensive threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes utility lands like Ghost Quarter and Sanctum of Ugin, along with card draw and filtering options to ensure consistency in executing its game plan.

The main idea of this Esper Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of counter spells, removal, hand disruption, and card advantage. By using cards like Cryptic Command, Logic Knot, and Esper Charm, the deck aims to control the board while also gaining card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Lingering Souls. The deck also utilizes flexible removal options like Path to Exile and Fatal Push to deal with threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and enable the use of powerful land utility cards like Celestial Colonnade.

The deck revolves around disrupting the opponent's resources and controlling the board through cards like Smallpox, Thoughtseize, and Liliana of the Veil. The goal is to strip the opponent's hand of key cards, sacrifice their creatures, and ultimately grind them down with powerful threats like Bloodghast and Lingering Souls. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Sorin, Lord of Innistrad, Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to generate value and close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through attrition and resource denial.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful cards like Scapeshift and Primeval Titan, with the goal of triggering the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle land's ability to deal lethal damage to the opponent's creatures or life total. By using cards like Hour of Promise and Khalni Heart Expedition, the deck can quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods to control the board and protect its combo pieces.

This Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of artifact creatures with the help of cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer, while using Cranial Plating to pump up those creatures and deal massive damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Springleaf Drum, Mox Opal, and Signal Pest, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and efficient artifact synergies. Additionally, cards like Galvanic Blast provide reach and removal, while the manlands Blinkmoth Nexus and Inkmoth Nexus provide additional threats that can end the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Obzedat, Ghost Council to quickly reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard, while also having access to disruption through cards like Thoughtseize and Path to Exile. The deck also includes card draw and selection to help find combo pieces quickly, as well as ways to protect the combo with cards like Fatal Push and Lingering Souls. The overall goal is to assemble the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to win the game through a powerful reanimation strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressively lowering your own life total to make Death's Shadow and Angler powerful threats. It also utilizes efficient removal spells and countermagic to control the board while digging for key cards with cantrips like Serum Visions and Thought Scour. The deck aims to disrupt your opponent's plans with hand disruption like Thoughtseize and counters like Stubborn Denial, while applying pressure with fast, large creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler. It combines a low curve with powerful threats and disruption to quickly close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a solid board presence with efficient creatures and versatile spells. The deck aims to tempo out the opponent, utilizing cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage to outvalue the opponent while protecting its threats with Spell Queller and Vendilion Clique. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to various matchups and scenarios. Overall, the deck excels at grinding out long games and outmaneuvering opponents with a mix of control and midrange elements.

The main concept of this Modern Abzan Aggro deck is to disrupt opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also controlling the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly. Additionally, cards like Lingering Souls provide a steady stream of threats, while planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil can help control the game and protect your creatures. The manabase is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient creature threats, supported by powerful artifacts. By utilizing the affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of artifacts, the deck can quickly deploy a board presence and equip Cranial Plating to deal massive damage. Steel Overseer and Signal Pest further boost the power of the creatures, while Throne of the God-Pharaoh can provide additional damage over time. The inclusion of removal options like Galvanic Blast ensures that the deck can handle opposing threats while maintaining its aggressive strategy.

The main idea behind this deck is to deal as much direct damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game while maintaining a steady stream of damage with cards like Shrine of Burning Rage and Skullcrack. By focusing on a fast and aggressive strategy, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, which can be used to repeatedly activate abilities or cast spells like Walking Ballista for a game-winning finish. The deck also includes a toolbox of creatures like Kitchen Finks, Eternal Witness, and Renegade Rallier to provide flexibility and resilience in different matchups. Chord of Calling and Collected Company serve as key enablers to find and deploy the necessary pieces for the combo or disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes disruptive spells like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the board, while also using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to apply pressure and deal damage. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration from lands like Eldrazi Temple and the Urza's Lands to bring out high-cost threats like Karn Liberated and All Is Dust early in the game. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Matter Reshaper, along with mana acceleration from Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Chalice of the Void and other disruption spells like Dismember and All Is Dust help control the board and protect the Eldrazi creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive plays and disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure victories in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to fuel the power of Death's Shadow. By efficiently using cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to enable Death's Shadow and other threats like Gurmag Angler and Young Pyromancer, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. These threats are backed up by a suite of versatile spells like Stubborn Denial, Fatal Push, and Kolaghan's Command to control the board and protect your key creatures, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a streamlined game plan of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with counter spells and removal, while also utilizing powerful midrange threats like Nahiri, the Harbinger and Elspeth, Sun's Champion. The deck also has a combo finish with Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai, allowing for infinite copies of the Guardian. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command provide flexibility and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with strong threats and efficient interaction.
